content:
TITLE: Cloning the Text Generator Plugin Repository
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the Obsidian Text Generator plugin repository to your Obsidian vault's plugins folder, including all necessary submodules. This is the first step in the manual installation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Plugin Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required dependencies for the Text Generator plugin using pnpm package manager. This step prepares the environment for building the plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Text Generator Plugin
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Text Generator plugin for production use in Obsidian. This creates the compiled version of the plugin that can be loaded by Obsidian.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to the Plugin Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to change directory into the newly cloned Text Generator plugin folder. This is required before installing dependencies and building the plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd obsidian-textgenerator-plugin
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Plugin in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: Alternative command for development that continuously rebuilds the plugin as changes are made. This is useful for developers contributing to the plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using async helpers with Handlebars
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to integrate and use asynchronous helpers with Handlebars. It demonstrates importing the library, registering an async sleep helper that resolves after a timeout, and using it in a template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin/blob/master/src/lib/async-handlebars-helper/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const handlebars = require('handlebars'),
      asyncHelpers = require('handlebars-async-helpers')

const hb = asyncHelpers(handlebars)

hb.registerHelper('sleep', async () => new Promise((resolve) => {
    setTimeout(() => resolve('Done!'), 1000)
}))

const template = hb.compile('Mark when is completed: {{#sleep}}{{/sleep}}')
const result = await template()
console.log(result)
// 'Mark when is completed: Done!'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing handlebars-async-helpers via npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the handlebars-async-helpers library using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nhaouari/obsidian-textgenerator-plugin/blob/master/src/lib/async-handlebars-helper/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install handlerbars-async-helpers
```
